item.title: [ 79] /pcbg/ - PC Building General
item.description:
>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE
Post build list: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Build guide: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Build_a_PC
Provide specific use cases (e.g. 4K editing, high FPS gaming)
State BUDGET and COUNTRY or you will NOT be helped

>CASE
Lian Li LANCOOL 216 (ATX mid-tower, high airflow)
Corsair 4000D Airflow (ATX mid-tower)
Fractal Design Meshify 2 (ATX mid-tower, airflow-focused)

>CPU
Budget Gaming: Intel Core i5-14400F (DDR4)
Premium Gaming: AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D
Budget Workstation: Intel Core i7-14700K
Premium Workstation: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X3D

>GPU
Budget Gaming: Intel Arc A580 8GB; NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060 8GB
Premium Gaming (1440p / 2K): NVIDIA RTX 5070 Ti 16GB, RTX 5080 16GB, AMD RX 9070 XT 16GB
Premium Gaming (2160p / 4K: NVIDIA RTX 4090 24GB, RTX 5090 32GB
Budget Workstation: NVIDIA RTX 5060 Ti 16GB (avoid AMD cards)
Premium Workstation: NVIDIA RTX 5090 32GB

>COOLER
Air: Thermalright Phantom Spirit 120 SE
Budget AIO: Thermalright Frozen Notte / Edge
Premium AIO: Arctic Liquid Freezer III
ITX: Thermalright AXP120-X67 / X47

>MOTHERBOARD
Avoid ASRock

>RAM
Budget: 32GB (2×16GB) DDR4-3600 CL18
Gaming (AMD): 32GB (2×16GB) DDR5-6000 CL30 (EXPO)
Gaming (Intel): 32GB (2×16GB) DDR5-6400 CL32 (XMP)
Workstation: 64GB (2×32GB) DDR5-5600 CL36

>STORAGE
Budget: 500GB WD Blue SN570
Gaming: 1TB WD Black SN770/SN850x
Budget Workstation: 2TB Kingston KC3000
Premium Workstation: 4TB Samsung 990 PRO

>PSU
Budget: 80+ Bronze
Premium: Modular PSU with ATX v3.1 and PCIe 5.1 support
Guide: https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/9

>MONITOR
Budget: LG 32GN650 (32"), Dell G2725D (27")
Gaming: MSI 321URX (32"), MSI 271QRX (27")
Workstation: Dell U3225QE
Guide: https://www.rtings.com/monitor/reviews/best

>OS
Windows 11 64-bit (Download official installer from Microsoft, no key needed)
or
Activate Windows @ >>>/g/fwt

>CASE FANS
Budget: Arctic F12 PWM
Premium: Noctua NF series (high-performance 120mm/140mm fans)

item.title: [165] /lmg/ - Local Models General
item.description:
/lmg/ - a general dedicated to the discussion and development of local language models.

Previous threads: >>104971401 & >>104967827

►News
>(04/06) Early preview release of ExLlamaV3, uses QTIP: https://github.com/turboderp-org/exllamav3
>(04/05) Dream 7B diffusion LLM checkpoints and inference code released: https://github.com/HKUNLP/Dream
>(04/05) Llama 4 Scout (109B-A17B) and Maverick (400B-A17B) released: https://ai.meta.com/blog/llama-4-multimodal-intelligence
>(04/03) Lumina-mGPT 2.0: VLLM for image modeling: https://github.com/Alpha-VLLM/Lumina-mGPT-2.0

►News Archive: https://rentry.org/lmg-news-archive
►Glossary: https://rentry.org/lmg-glossary
►Links: https://rentry.org/LocalModelsLinks
►Official /lmg/ card: https://files.catbox.moe/cbclyf.png

►Getting Started
https://rentry.org/lmg-lazy-getting-started-guide
https://rentry.org/lmg-build-guides
https://rentry.org/IsolatedLinuxWebService
https://rentry.org/tldrhowtoquant

►Further Learning
https://rentry.org/machine-learning-roadmap
https://rentry.org/llm-training
https://rentry.org/LocalModelsPapers

►Benchmarks
LiveBench: https://livebench.ai
Programming: https://livecodebench.github.io/leaderboard.html
Code Editing: https://aider.chat/docs/leaderboards
Context Length: https://github.com/hsiehjackson/RULER
Japanese: https://hf.co/datasets/lmg-anon/vntl-leaderboard
Censorbench: https://codeberg.org/jts2323/censorbench
GPUs: https://github.com/XiongjieDai/GPU-Benchmarks-on-LLM-Inference

►Tools
Alpha Calculator: https://desmos.com/calculator/ffngla98yc
GGUF VRAM Calculator: https://hf.co/spaces/NyxKrage/LLM-Model-VRAM-Calculator
Sampler Visualizer: https://artefact2.github.io/llm-sampling

►Text Gen. UI, Inference Engines
https://github.com/lmg-anon/mikupad
https://github.com/oobabooga/text-generation-webui
https://github.com/LostRuins/koboldcpp
https://github.com/ggerganov/llama.cpp
https://github.com/theroyallab/tabbyAPI
https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm

item.title: [490] >3 years since ChatGPT and DALL-E were made public >not a single notable game
item.description:
>3 years since ChatGPT and DALL-E were made public
>not a single notable game made with AI in the past 3 years
>not a single game developer bragging about programming their million dollar FOTM game using LLMs
>not a single game developer showing their AI workflow for creating graphics and audio and talking about how it speed up development or how much costs it reduced
>no one discussing actual tools and solutions, at most discussions revolve around concepts and not things that people actually use
>not even one guy writing a blogpost about his experiences with using generative AI in his critically acclaimed game
>all of this despite the fact that this is the most hyped up topic in tech space in the past three years
>all of this despite the fact that these kinds of discussions happen on the regular in the traditional game dev community
>3 years, hundreds of thousands of models, billions of dollars wasted on running the GPUs and not a single popular or commercially successful title that can be shown as an example of the technology actually doing what people claim it is able to do

this shit is just blockchain v3.0 isn't it
nothing but a bunch of promises and useless tech demos while actually useful products are nowhere to be seen

>inb4 it's not like that
name the games faggot

Original filename: 1380312606544.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [222] >Spend the first hour doing a boring (unskippable) tour guide with Sphene aroun
item.description:
>Spend the first hour doing a boring (unskippable) tour guide with Sphene around Solution 9
>New villain is yet another boring, forgettable charisma-vacuum Hiroi-type villain who just wants to le "evolve" the human race (wow what an original trope there)
>Attack on Solution 9 is, yet again, another cutscene with zero gameplay because Limsa AFKers hate to actually play the game (as seen with In from the Cold in EW)
>Sphene is the only good part of this patch, but she'll likely be axed for the crime of being an attractive female character in FFXIV
>Wuk is still there, barely does anything, but still there for some god-forsaken reason.
>That's it, that's the entire patch

So THIS is the supposed "new and improved" 7.2 MSQ? Yeah I'll stay unsubbed, thanks.

item.title: [ 98] /fglt/ - Friendly GNU/Linux Thread
item.description:
Come and take it

***** Please be civil, notice the "Friendly" in every Friendly GNU/Linux Thread *****
Users of all levels are welcome to ask questions about GNU/Linux and share their experiences.
Before asking for help, please check our list of resources.

Resources: Please spend at least a minute to check a web search engine with your question.
Many free software projects have active mailing lists.

$ man %command%
$ info %command%
$ %command% -h/--help
$ help %builtin/keyword%

Don't know what to look for?
$ apropos %something%

Check the Wikis (most troubleshoots work for all distros):
wiki.debian.org
wiki.gentoo.org
wiki.archlinux.org
wiki.alpinelinux.org

/g/'s Wiki on GNU/Linux:
gnu.org/gnu/gnu-linux-faq.en.html
wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU/Linux_naming_controversy

>Which distro should I choose?
nosystemd.org (SystemD is bloated malware)
gnu.org/distros/free-distros.en.html (FSF approved)
distrowatch.com/dwres.php?resource=major (Major Distributions)
>What are some cool programs?
harmful.cat-v.org/software
suckless.org/rocks
directory.fsf.org/wiki/Main_Page
>What are some cool terminal commands and where can I learn the command line?
mywiki.wooledge.org/BashGuide
commandlinefu.com/commands/browse
>Where can I learn more about Free Software?
fsf.org
gnu.org
stallman.org
>How to break out of the botnet?
ryf.fsf.org/products
fsf.org/resources/hw
en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-source_hardware
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ag1AKIl_2GM


GNU/Linux Games: >>>/t/1175569 >>>/vg/lgg
IRC: #sqt on Rizon

item.title: [ 48] Nationwide anti trump protests
item.description:
Massive nationwide sprawling huge protests are underway by the Jacobins and it's beautiful
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/05/us/politics/anti-trump-protests-hands-off.html
Mass Protests Across the Country Show Resistance to Trump
Demonstrators packed the streets in cities and towns to rail against government cutbacks, financial turmoil and what they viewed as attacks on democracy.

They came out in defense of national parks and small businesses, public education and health care for veterans, abortion rights and fair elections. They marched against tariffs and oligarchs, dark money and fascism, the deportation of legal immigrants and the Department of Government Efficiency.

Demonstrators had no shortage of causes as they gathered in towns and cities across the country on Saturday to protest President Trump’s agenda. Rallies were planned in all 50 states, and images posted on social media showed dense crowds in places as diverse as St. Augustine, Fla.; Salt Lake City and rainy Frankfort, Ky.

“Pouring rain, 43 degrees, biting wind, and people are still here in Albany in the thousands,” said Ron Marz, a comic book writer who posted a photo of the crowd at the New York State Capitol on X.

While crowd sizes are difficult to estimate, organizers said that more than 600,000 people had signed up to participate and that events also took place in U.S. territories and a dozen locations across the globe.

On Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, the protest stretched for nearly 20 blocks. In Chicago, thousands flooded Daley Plaza and adjacent streets, while, in the nation’s capital, tens of thousands surrounded the Washington Monument. In Atlanta, the police estimated the crowd marching to the gold-domed statehouse at over 20,000.

Mr. Trump, who was playing golf in Florida on Saturday, appeared to be largely ignoring the protests. The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

Original filename: 1743346479177574m.jpg

item.title: [468] Khazan the First Berserker
item.description:
I got suckered into trying this trash demo because of some hype here, but wowee, it’s just another lazy, uninspired soulslop clone with laughably bad telegraphs and attack animations so delayed they feel like they’re buffering IRL. First, the starting weapon’s range is so pathetically short it’s like fighting enemies with a toothpick, and to top it off, you’re forced to slog through an entirely different zone just to get anything remotely usable like the Dragonslayer™, a weapon that should’ve been available from minute one if these devs had half a brain cell between them. And let’s talk about balance, or rather, the complete lack thereof, since endurance/stamina is literally all that matters here. This game doesn’t just fail to dodge roll-slap allegations; it belly-flops straight into them while laughing in your face. Apparently balancing gameplay is too much effort for these devs. Also, I think this game is screaming for the rally mechanic from Bloodborne or literally any semblance of creativity in its combat design. You’re supposed to be playing as a bloodsoaked Berserker à la the protagonist from The Northman, but instead you feel like some clumsy oaf flailing around in the snow in slow motion. I have plenty more complaints, but I'll cut it short. Absolute trash-tier effort from these devs typical of DAKS; don’t waste your time or sheckles.

Original filename: Korean Slop.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [217] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 172: Supernova Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art, and make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokemon related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL·E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‘buzz’ currency. You get about 50 every day plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pokemon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokemon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread: >>57666723

Original filename: Flareon.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 55] Trans Woman Arrested in Florida for using Women's Bathrooms
item.description:
https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-news/trans-students-arrest-violating-florida-bathroom-law-thought-first-rcna199697
A transgender college student declared “I am here to break the law” before entering a women’s restroom at the Florida State Capitol and being led out in handcuffs by police. Civil rights attorneys say the arrest of Marcy Rheintgen last month is the first they know of for violating transgender bathroom restrictions passed by numerous state legislatures across the country.

Capitol police had been alerted and were waiting for Rheintgen, 20, when she entered the building in Tallahassee March 19. They told her she would receive a trespass warning once she entered the women’s restroom to wash her hands and pray the rosary, but she was later placed under arrest when she refused to leave, according to an arrest affidavit.

Rheintgen faces a misdemeanor trespassing charge punishable by up to 60 days in jail and is due to appear in court in May.

“I wanted people to see the absurdity of this law in practice,” Rheintgen told The Associated Press. “If I’m a criminal, it’s going to be so hard for me to live a normal life, all because I washed my hands. Like, that’s so insane.”

At least 14 states have adopted laws barring transgender women from entering women’s bathrooms at public schools and, in some cases, other government buildings. Only two — Florida and Utah — criminalize the act. A judge on Wednesday temporarily blocked Montana’s new bathroom law.

Rheintgen’s arrest in Florida is the first that American Civil Liberties Union attorneys are aware of in any state with a criminal ban, senior staff attorney Jon Davidson said.

Original filename: 1729484003902130.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 39] Trump's America:60% Chance of Recession.
item.description:
JPMorgan analysts say recession risk increased to 60% since Trump announced tariffs: 'There will be blood'
By Katherine Tanya low

https://www.businessinsider.com/jpmorgan-analysts-recession-risk-trump-tariffs-2025-4

JPMorgan analysts told clients that Trump's tariff plan will have drastic economic effects.
The risk of the global economy falling into a recession has increased from 40% to 60%, they warned.
The restrictive trade policy also risks supply-side damage that'll lower US growth in the long run.

JPMorgan's chief global economist has a bleak outlook on President Donald Trump's aggressive tariff policy: "There will be blood."

In a research note to clients published on Thursday, JPMorgan's Bruce Kasman, along with several other company economists, warned that the risk of the global economy falling into a recession has increased from 40% to 60% in response to Wednesday's "Liberation Day" tariff announcement.

Trump on Wednesday announced sweeping 10% tariffs on goods from any country imported into the United States, and even higher tariffs for 60 trading partners with a persistent trade deficit with the US.

Original filename: 27157966.jpg

Masked ‘Antifa’ goons destroy TPUSA campus event, mass assault conservatives while cops do nothing

Campus police and the University of California, Davis, are being slammed for doing nothing to stop a mass assault against conservatives.

“They stole the canopy, ripped down banners, smashed foam boards, and even tried to steal the iPad and laptop of a [TP USA student] field rep,” TPUSA reported on Thursday.

“TPUSA students were shoved and had objects thrown at them—while police did nothing,” the group added in a post on X. “Only after the damage was done did law enforcement finally form a perimeter. This is the reality of free speech on campus.”

item.title: [ 35] Trump Worldstars the Houthis
item.description:
https://news.abplive.com/news/world/oops-they-will-never-sink-our-ships-again-trump-shares-video-of-airstrike-on-yemen-houthis-1762987

President Donald Trump on Friday shared a video footage of US military airstrike against Houthis in Yemen. The black-and-white footage resembled drone imagery, showing the aftermath of a devastating bomb blast.

In the video, about 70 people can be seen standing in an oval, surrounding one person near the center of the formation.Seconds later a massive explosion takes place which sends a bright flash followed by dark plume of smoke up into the sky.

The bird-eye view then zooms out to a wider angle showing several vehicles near the attack site as smoke continues to blow out. When the smoke clears, dozens of bodies can be seen lying motionless on the ground with a huge crater visible.

Trump said the targets were Houthi terrorists plotting an attack when the strike was conducted by the US.

Captioning the video, President Trump wrote, “These Houthis gathered for instructions on an attack. Oops, there will be no attack by these Houthis! They will never sink our ships again!”

item.title: [143] Please stop calling this "BBQ" or "Barbecue". It's grilling, or cooking out, or
item.description:
Please stop calling this "BBQ" or "Barbecue". It's grilling, or cooking out, or having a cookout. I'll even accept a barbie, it's derived enough. But calling it barbecue just makes it confusing to those unaware of what actual barbecue is (the sovthern tradition of smoking meat and other food items for a protracted amount of time, infusing the smoke flavor into the food, often using a sauce, rub, or mop to create an outer layer on the end product).

*You should check on google if a place is still in business before you plan to visit it*

ーJR Passー
Since JR has adjusted the prices for the pass, not really worth it anymore, unless you want to travel by train very extensively. You can plug in your itinerary in the links below and compare prices to the JR Pass.
>https://japantravel.navitime.com/en/area/jp/route/
>https://world.jorudan.co.jp/mln/en/
With the increased price of the JR Pass, local train passes might be good deals now.

New prices starting May 2024
>7 day Pass: ¥50,000
>14 day Pass: ¥80,000

item.title: [ 49] Sweden
item.description:
Is Sweden a nice place to visit? Was planning a trip in the summer but I’m worried the place is full of Muslims and blacks now. Is it really that dangerous?
Is it true that Swedish girls are coal burners? I’m a white American with blonde hair and blue eyes. Will I get completely ignored because I look like I’m Swedish?
Do I need to know any Swedish? Can I get by with English?
Is there any good food to eat in Sweden?
Does Sweden use euros?
Is it true that Swedish people are borderline autistic and refuse to talk to strangers or make friend with people they don’t know?
What are some fun things to do in Stockholm? How is public transportation?

item.title: [ 64] Which country has the worst tourists? I’ll start: Germany. First of all, th
item.description:
Which country has the worst tourists? I’ll start: Germany.
First of all, there’s so fucking many of them anywhere you go. They’re rude and everywhere and they think they’re superior to everyone else and they actually believe it genuinely, not like Americans who play it up to be funny. God forbid you get stranded in a hostel with a bunch of Germans.

item.title: [153] /out/ings with a pipe
item.description:
Old thread: >>2774508

This is a thread for enjoying a pipe while doing outdoor activities. If you ask why this belongs on /out/, you've never spent an evening by the campfire with a pipe silently enjoying the nature around you, and you're missing out.

>how to get started
Purchase a Missouri Meerschaum Legend and a pouch of Half and Half or Captain Black tobacco, available at most smoke shops. You will need a lighter or match, and something to tamp it with--a large nail works well if you don't have a pipe tool. Fill the pipe with tobacco, pack it down halfway, top it off, pack it down to 3/4, top it off again, pack gently and enjoy. Smoke slower than you think you need to, the tobacco tastes best when it is burning cool. Tamp and re-light as needed. If you still have trouble, try different methods on YouTube until you find one that works for you.

>smoking a pipe will give you cancer
While any tobacco consumption comes with some risk, the cancer risks from occasional pipe use are pretty minimal. Educate yourself and make your own informed health decisions. Some info here https://aacrjournals.org/cancerpreventionresearch/article/10/12/704/46541/Association-between-Cigar-or-Pipe-Smoking-and

>muh weed
Not the time or place. Start your own thread

>I DON’T LIKE WHAT YOU LIKE REEEEEE
Then leave the thread. Pipes have been a part of outdoors culture for centuries. If you don’t like it, leave.
